channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South African ambassador 'no longer welcome' in US, Rubio says
item.description: The US Secretary of State called the ambassador a "race-baiting politician who hates America".

item.title: After Columbia arrests, international college students fall silent
Transgender veterans' health services in question as VA rescinds guidance on care
item.description: In an internal VA memo seen by NPR, the VA says it's rescinding a directive that contains detailed guidance on the kind of care transgender veterans c...

item.title: Extreme weather expected Saturday gets rarely used ‘high risk’ designation
item.description: A dynamic storm system threatening to spawn powerful tornadoes and hail as big as baseballs has earned a relatively rare designation from forecasters.

item.title: Islamic State leader in Iraq and Syria killed, US says
item.description: Abdallah Makki Muslih al-Rifa was head of IS's most senior decision-making body, the US Central Command said.

item.title: Search continues in Dominican Republic for missing student Sudiksha Konanki
item.description: The search for the missing University of Pittsburgh student, who was on spring break in Punta Cana, is entering its second week.

item.title: State senator and longtime trucker on potential Alaska-bound toll
item.description: Canada's British Columbia is proposing a law that would allow the province to toll U.S. trucks using its roads to travel to Alaska. Alaska Republican ...

item.title: Block on Trump's executive orders restricting DEI programs is lifted
item.description: An appeals court on Friday lifted a block on executive orders seeking to end government support for diversity, equity and inclusion programs, allowing...

item.title: State of ceasefire talks between Russia-Ukraine and Israel-Hamas
item.description: The U.S. is holding talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin in hopes of ending the war in Ukraine. Ukraine has already accepted the terms for a 30...

item.title: More than 50 universities face federal investigations as part of Trump’s anti-DEI campaign
Ovens and bone fragments - BBC visits Mexican cartel 'extermination' site
item.description: The BBC's Will Grant visits the site believed to have been used by drug cartels to dispose of victims' remains.

item.title: Appeals court rules Trump can implement anti-DEI executive orders for now
item.description: The decision from the three-judge panel allows the orders to be enforced as a lawsuit challenging them plays out.

item.title: Arlington National Cemetery stops highlighting some historical figures on its website
item.description: Articles, photos and videos that are seen as promoting DEI will be removed under the new approach.

item.title: Rubio says the U.S. will revoke more student visas
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced that the U.S. will revoke more student visas in the coming days. At a G-7 meeting in Canada Friday, Rubio acc...

item.title: 'Their untold stories need to be told': Teens capture India's labourers in pictures
item.description: Teen photographers showcased the backbreaking work done by India's 400 million labourers.

item.title: Leader of ISIS in Iraq and Syria killed, Pentagon says
item.description: On his Truth Social platform Friday night, President Trump wrote that "the fugitive leader of ISIS in Iraq was killed."

item.title: Turmoil rocks Columbia University as Trump administration demands changes — or else
item.description: The Trump administration delivered an ultimatum to leaders of Columbia University: Make a series of major changes or lose out on billions in federal a...

item.title: Tesla, led by Elon Musk, warns of export retaliation due to new Trump tariffs
item.description: Tesla has joined the ranks of U.S. companies concerned that Trump's aggressive tariff policies may negatively affect global sales.
